snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes trying to come up with a digital analog to the book cover, Google notifiying more than 20,000 Web sites that they...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes trying to come up with a digital analog to the book cover, Google notifiying more than 20,000 Web sites that they may have been hacked and Google's challenge to Dropbox.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: E-Book Covers and Digital Resurrection
